docs.snippet: PARIS, Jan. 15. -- Premier Pierre Laval today conferred with several foreign diplomats regarding matters to come before the League of Nations Council Monday. Dr. Augusto de Vasconcellos of Portugal, chairman of the Committee of Eighteen on sanctions;...
docs.lead_paragraph: PARIS, Jan. 15. -- Premier Pierre Laval today conferred with several foreign diplomats regarding matters to come before the League of Nations Council Monday. Dr. Augusto de Vasconcellos of Portugal, chairman of the Committee of Eighteen on sanctions; Vittorio Cerutti, the Italian Ambassador, and Bosidor Pouritch, the Yugoslav Minister, discussed the Italo-Ethiopian question.
docs.abstract: Confers with Dr A de Vasconcellos of Portugal, Ital Amb Cerutti and Yugoslav Min Pouritch on Italo-Ethiopian issues; Soviet Amb Potemkin discusses Franco-Soviet pact and other issues; Laval to attend League Council session

headline.main: LAVAL SEES ENVOYS ON ETHIOPIAN ISSUE; Will Go to Geneva Himself for Meeting Monday -- French Favor Deferring Action.

docs.snippet: AT any moment, day or night, President Roosevelt can select any one of 150 telephones in the White House and talk with friends, official emissaries of the government -- in fact, to any of the 30,000,000 telephone subscribers in the sixty nations...
docs.lead_paragraph: AT any moment, day or night, President Roosevelt can select any one of 150 telephones in the White House and talk with friends, official emissaries of the government -- in fact, to any of the 30,000,000 telephone subscribers in the sixty nations linked by telephone service.

docs.snippet: LONDON, Jan. 17. -- Gold imports in December were reported today as amounting to 15,921,000 and exports to 8,000,000, making the total imports for the year 244,091,000, compared with 262,483,000 in 1934. Exports of the metal were 174,020,000, against...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Jan. 17. -- Gold imports in December were reported today as amounting to 15,921,000 and exports to 8,000,000, making the total imports for the year 244,091,000, compared with 262,483,000 in 1934. Exports of the metal were 174,020,000, against 128,713,000 in 1934.

headline.main: 70,071,000 IN GOLD GAINED BY BRITAIN; London Gives Import and Export Data for 1935 With Chief Nations Affected. MOST SENT FROM FRANCE Transvaal Shipped 70,848,000 -- Largest Export Volume Was to the United States.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: Foreign exchanges declined sharply last week. The recovery in the dollar was noteworthy in view of the rumors of further devaluation and the flight of capital, but bankers said that little fear of these possibilities was held in foreign financial...
docs.lead_paragraph: Foreign exchanges declined sharply last week. The recovery in the dollar was noteworthy in view of the rumors of further devaluation and the flight of capital, but bankers said that little fear of these possibilities was held in foreign financial circles. The volume of business fell with the recession in values, the turnover being substantially under that in the preceding week.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED JAN. 18, 1936.

docs.snippet: GENEVA, Jan. 19. -- A full Italian delegation, including not only Baron Pompeo Aloisi, chief delegate, but also Dr. Guido Rocco, was among the first to arrive hero today for the ninetieth session of the League of Nations Council beginning tomorrow.
docs.lead_paragraph: GENEVA, Jan. 19. -- A full Italian delegation, including not only Baron Pompeo Aloisi, chief delegate, but also Dr. Guido Rocco, was among the first to arrive hero today for the ninetieth session of the League of Nations Council beginning tomorrow.

headline.main: OIL BAN UP AGAIN IN LEAGUE TODAY; Council Expected to Delay It Anew While the Delegates Explore Other Matters. SOVIET PLEA IS ON AGENDA Litvinoff Believed Ready to Use Case Against Uruguay to Cast Off Comintern.

docs.snippet: A moderate decline developed yesterday in bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange. A downward readjustment was not unexpected in trading circles in view of the persistent advance in all classes in the last month. High-grade, as well as the more...
docs.lead_paragraph: A moderate decline developed yesterday in bond trading on the New York Stock Exchange. A downward readjustment was not unexpected in trading circles in view of the persistent advance in all classes in the last month. High-grade, as well as the more speculative bonds, were subjected to profit-taking and declines ranging from fractions to about a point ruled over a broad list of issues at the end of the day.

headline.main: GENERAL SETBACK HITS BOND MARKET.; Trading Pace Slackens, However, as Moderate Declines Spread Through List. TREASURY ISSUES EASIER Last Week's Speculative Favorites Bear Selling Brunt -- Suspense on TVA Pares Utilities.
